greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of words A(n,k), either empty or beginning with the first letter of the k-ary alphabet, where each letter of the alphabet occurs n times and letters of neighboring word positions are equal or neighbors in the alphabet; square array A(n,k), n>=0, k>=0, read by antidiagonals.
comment: Also the number of (n*k-1)-step walks on k-dimensional cubic lattice from (1,0,...,0) to (n,n,...,n) with positive unit steps in all dimensions such that the absolute difference of the dimension indices used in consecutive steps is <= 1.
example: A(0,0) = A(n,0) = A(0,k) = 1: the empty word.
|  xx  |   |  x x |   |  x  x|   | x x  |   | x  x |
|    xx|   |   x x|   |   xx |   |    xx|   |  xx  |
maple: b:= proc(t, l) option remember; local n; n:= nops(l);
mathematica: b[t_, l_List] := b[t, l] = Module[{n = Length[l]}, If[n < 2 || {0} == Union[l], 1, If[l[[t]] > 0, b[t, Table[l[[i]] - If[i == t, 1, 0], {i, 1, n}]], 0] + If[t < n && l[[t + 1]] > 0, b[t + 1, Table[l[[i]] - If[i == t + 1, 1, 0], {i, 1, n}]], 0] + If[t > 1 && l[[t - 1]] > 0, b[t - 1, Table[l[[i]] - If[i == t - 1, 1, 0], {i, 1, n}]], 0]]]; A[n_, k_] := If[n == 0 || k == 0, 1, b[1, Join[{n - 1}, Array[n&, k - 1]]]]; Table[Table[A[n, d - n], {n, 0, d}], {d, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 27 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Feb 29 2012
